properties.areaDesc: Daviess, KY; Vanderburgh, IN; Henderson, KY; Spencer, IN; Warrick, IN
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 15 at 7:33PM CST until February 23 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Kentucky...Illinois...

Ohio River at Owensboro...Newburgh Dam...Evansville...
Mount Vernon...J.T. Myers Dam...Shawneetown...and Golconda

.The Ohio River from Owensboro down to Golconda continues to rise.
All seven of these points are expected to crest in the minor flood category
on Wednesday or Thursday of next week. The only exception is Shawneetown,
which is forecast to reach the moderate flood category on Tuesday.
They will start to fall slowly late in the week.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Ohio River at Newburgh Dam
* until Sunday February 23.
* At  7:00 PM Saturday the stage was 45.0 feet.
* Flood Stage is 38.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The river will continue rising to near 45.2 feet by
early Wednesday morning. The river will fall below flood stage
Sunday February 23 early afternoon.
* Impact...At 46.0 Feet...Highway 662 near the old Lock and Dam 47
begins to flood. This is approximately 1/2 mile downstream from the
current lock and dam.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
